title: Top US officials urge Taliban to quit arms and end Afghan war
body:
(FILE) US Vice President Mike Pence (R) sits with Ivanka Trump (L) as President Donald Trump delivers remarks on American involvement in Afghanistan at the Fort Myer military base in Arlington, Virginia, USA, Aug. 21, 2017. EPA/MARK WILSON / POOL

The commander of United States Forces and NATO in Afghanistan, General John Nicholson and US Ambassador Hugo Llorens Thursday urged the Taliban to lay down arms and end the war.

The rebels were unlikely to win against America's new strategy on Afghanistan and should join the peace process, Nicholson said in Kabul at a joint press conference with Llorens after President Donald Trump Monday committed to an open-ended involvement of the US in the Afghan conflict, including sending more troops to the conflict-torn country.
